Description: Woman's lip ornament made of wood painted black
Curator's comments: See John Petherick, Egypt, the Soudan and Central Africa, 1861, p.401: (on the Dor) ‘The women would be handsome if it were not for a disfiguration of the under lip, in which circular pieces of wood are inserted, varying in size according to age from a sixpence to a florin.’
Acquisition name: Donated by: Augustus Henry Lane Fox Pitt-Rivers
Acquisition notes: Given by Col. A Lane Fox (Pitt-Rivers) on 5 May 1873, who had acquired it at the Petherick sale in 1862.
